glsa.title: gv: Exploitable Buffer Overflow
glsa.synopsis: gv contains an exploitable buffer overflow that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: gv is a PostScript and PDF viewer for X which provides a user interface for the ghostscript interpreter.

description.p: gv contains a buffer overflow vulnerability where an unsafe sscanf() call is used to interpret PDF and PostScript files.

impact.p: By enticing a user to view a malformed PDF or PostScript file an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running gv.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are encouraged to upgrade to the latest available version of gv.
